data.userText:
As a developer, you can modify the starter template to create your own template.
 
You can download and modify the contents of the template package (StarterTemplate.zip) directly on your local system, but if you want to modify the default site or see the effects of changes you make to the theme, it is helpful to install the template and create a new site from the template. You can use the editor to make changes to the site and use the desktop app to access the theme files and any custom component files. When you are done, you can create a new template from the site that you modified.
 
Here's the overall process for installing the starter template, creating a new site, and creating a new template using the site as the template's default site.
  1. Upload the starter template package (StarterTemplate.zip) to a folder in your Oracle Documents Cloud Service account.
  2. From the Oracle Sites Cloud Service Templates folder, click Create and then click Import a template package.
  3. Select the template package (.zip file) you uploaded and click OK.
  4. Select the newly imported template from the list of templates and click Create Site.
  5. Click the Sites folder, select the site, and click Edit.
  6. Provide a name for the update and click Create.
  7. Click Edit to make changes. You can add and remove pages and page content, and when you are done, save and publish your changes.
    If you make changes to the theme, you can publish the changes and see them immediately in the associated site.
  8. To create a new template with all of your changes, select the site and click Create Template.

Working with Files
 
You can download and work with individual files using the web interface or you can synchronize entire folders with the desktop app.
 
Web Interface
 
You can browse the folders and download individual files for any of the folder types other than sites (use the Oracle Sites Cloud Service editor to work directly with sites). After you modify a file, you can upload the file that contains your changes to create a new version of the file.
 
Desktop App
 

To make the entire contents of a folder directly available on a local computer, use the Oracle Documents Cloud Service desktop app to synchronize the folder to your computer. You can select and synchronize multiple folders, browse the folders, and work directly with files just as you do with other local files.
